ygData.subject: Re: Languages
ygData.msgSnippet: To get language increases I have had to log out then log back on.  I believe that zoning might have a similar effect and I just didn t notice it. -- Elidain,
ygData.messageBody:
To get language increases I have had to log out then log back on. I believe
that zoning might have a similar effect and I just didn't notice it.

-- Elidain, Veeshan

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Steven Zaharakis [mailto:sz200@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 10, 1999 7:14 PM
> To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Languages
>
>
> From: Steven Zaharakis <sz200@...>
>
>
> For some reason when we zoned the language skill seemed to
> increase RIGHT
> AFTER zoning (meaning we zoned and the first 10 secs of spamming after
> zoning gave us 1-2 blue increase messages). Don't ask me why....it just
> happens that way for us all the time.
>
> But it is true that in order to see how much you have risen
> in a language
> you need to zone for the skill list to change. For example if you are
> Awful in Troll and you get a Troll to spam you for 20 mins. Your Troll
> skill will be listed as awful till you zone.
>
> Zolthar
>
> At 06:42 PM 5/10/99 EDT, you wrote:
> >From: Elminstr95@...
> >
> >why do you have to zone when learning languages? i have never
> had to zone
> >when spamming and i learn just fine
> >
> >------------------------------------------------------------------------

> research. Please keep the emails on topic.
> >
> >
> >
>
